titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James White, Bond
CWG10037

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: James White being in custody charged with the offense of Felony & being admited to bail in the sum of one hundred Dollars. Now I John Q A King, do hereby undertake that the above named James White will appear in the McCracken Equity & Criminal Court on the first day of its next January term to answer said charges and will at all times render himself amenable to the Orders & process of said court in the prosecution of said charge; and if convicted will render himself in Execution thereof ^or^ and if he shall fail to perform either of these conditions that he will pay to the Commonwealth of Ky the sum of one hundred Dollars

A Copy Attest
B Small Clk
By T T Ewell D C

Commonwealth of Ky
vs } Copy Bond
James White
